## Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Functional Consultant
This course provides students with the skills and knowledge required to successfully take a role as a Dynamics 365 Sales Functional Consultant. The course includes coverage of configuring Dynamics 365 Sales, managing cores sales tables, and configuring additional tools and services. Completion of the course prepares students for the [MB-210: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Functional Consultant](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/exams/mb-210) certification exam.
Students may be eligible for ACE college credit if they pass this certification exam. See [ACE college credit for certification exams](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/college-credit) for details.
## Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing
This course reviews the marketing application configuration needed to drive business growth. It dives into lead management, marketing forms and pages, segmentation, and email marketing messages. All these pieces are tied together through interactive customer journey design, including event and survey configuration. Completion of the course prepares students for the [MB-220: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/exams/mb-220) certification exam.
Students may be eligible for ACE college credit if they pass this certification exam. See [ACE college credit for certification exams](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/college-credit) for details.
Download the course datasheet [here.](https://aka.ms/mb220coursedatasheet)
## Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions
This course focuses on how to demonstrate subject matter expertise in designing cloud and hybrid solutions that run on Azure. Students will learn how to design identity, governance, and monitoring solutions; design data storage solutions; design business continuity solutions; and design infrastructure solutions. Completion of this course prepares students for the [AZ-305: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions](https://aka.ms/AZ305exam) exam.

# Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions

 Course AZ-305T00-A: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions 

##  At a glance

- Level 

[Advanced](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?levels=advanced&resource_type=course)
- Product 

[Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure&resource_type=course)
- Role 

[Solution Architect](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=solution-architect&resource_type=course)
- Languages 

EnglishChinese (Simplified)FrenchGermanJapaneseKoreanPortuguese (Brazil)Spanish
- Course Duration 

4 days
- Related certifications 

[Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/azure-solutions-architect/)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Overview

This course teaches Azure Solution Architects how to design infrastructure solutions. Course topics cover governance, compute, application architecture, storage, data integration, authentication, networks, business continuity, and migrations. The course combines lecture with case studies to demonstrate basic architect design principles.

#### Audience Profile

Successful students have experience and knowledge in IT operations, including networking, virtualization, identity, security, business continuity, disaster recovery, data platforms, and governance. Students also have experience designing and architecting solutions. Before attending this course, students must have previous experience deploying or administering Azure resources and strong conceptual knowledge of:

- Azure compute technologies such as VMs, containers and serverless solutions
- Azure virtual networking to include load balancers
- Azure Storage technologies (unstructured and databases)
- General application design concepts such as messaging and high availability

### Skills earned upon completion

### Audience profile
As a Microsoft Azure solutions architect, you have subject matter expertise in designing cloud and hybrid solutions that run on Azure, including:
1. Compute

3. Storage
4. Monitoring

2. Recommend a solution for routing logs
3. Recommend a monitoring solution
#### Design authentication and authorization solutions
1. Recommend an authentication solution
2. Recommend an identity management solution
3. Recommend a solution for authorizing access to Azure resources

2. Recommend a solution for managing compliance
3. Recommend a solution for identity governance

4. Recommend a solution for data protection

# Exam AZ-305: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions

As a Microsoft Azure solutions architect, you have subject matter expertise in designing cloud and hybrid solutions that run on Azure, including:

- Compute
- Network
- Storage
- Monitoring
- Security

Your responsibilities for this role include advising stakeholders and translating business requirements into designs for Azure solutions that align with the Azure Well-Architected Framework and Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure. In this role, you implement solutions on Azure by partnering with various other job roles, including:

- Developers
- Administrators
- Security engineers
- Data engineers

As a candidate for this exam, you should have advanced experience and knowledge of IT operations, including networking, virtualization, identity, security, business continuity, disaster recovery, data platforms, and governance. You should manage how decisions in each area affect an overall solution. In addition, you should have experience with:

- Azure administration
- Azure development
- DevOps processes

Important

The English language version of this exam was updated on October 18, 2024. Review the study guide linked in the “Tip” box for details about latest changes. If a localized version of this exam is available, it will be updated approximately eight weeks after this date. While Microsoft makes every effort to update localized versions as noted, there may be times when the localized versions of this exam are not updated on this schedule.

Passing score: 700. [Learn more about exam scores.](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exam-scoring-reports#scores-needed-to-pass-exams)

Tip

- Watch [AZ-305 exam prep videos](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/shows/exam-readiness-zone/preparing-for-az-305-design-identity-governance-and-monitoring-solutions-1-of-4) on Learn
- Review the [AZ-305 study guide](https://aka.ms/AZ305-StudyGuide) to help you prepare for the exam
- Demo the exam experience by visiting our [exam sandbox](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2226877)

- Learning Path
- 6 Modules

##  At a glance

- Level 

[Intermediate](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?levels=intermediate&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure Storage](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure-storage&resource_type=learning%20path)[Azure Virtual Network](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure-virtual-network&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Solution Architect](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=solution-architect&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Architecture](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=architecture&resource_type=learning%20path)

Learn the basic Azure concepts you'll need to know as an Azure infrastructure architect. This path gives you the knowledge to be successful as you begin studying for AZ-305: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions.

## Prerequisites

You should be familiar with basic computing concepts and terminology. Experience designing architecture solutions are desired, but not required.

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Describe the core architectural components of Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-core-architectural-components-of-azure/)

This module explains the basic infrastructure components of Microsoft Azure. You'll learn about the physical infrastructure, how resources are managed, and have a chance to create an Azure resource.

[Describe Azure compute and networking services](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-azure-compute-networking-services/)

This module focuses on some of the computer services and networking services available within Azure.

[Describe Azure storage services](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-azure-storage-services/)

This module introduces you to storage in Azure, including things such as different types of storage and how a distributed infrastructure can make your data more resilient.

[Describe Azure identity, access, and security](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-azure-identity-access-security/)

This module covers some of the authorization and authentication methods available with Azure.

[Introduction to the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/cloud-adoption-framework/)

This module covers the basics of how to use the Cloud Adoption Framework, which is a set of documentation, implementation guidance, best practices, and tools that help you align your strategy for business, people, and technology.

[Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/azure-well-architected-introduction/)

You want to build great things on Azure, but you're not sure exactly what that means. Using key principles throughout your architecture, regardless of technology choice, can help you design, build, and continuously improve your architecture.","contentUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/microsoft-azure-architect-design-prerequisites/"}]}

results.content:
# Microsoft Advanced Role-Based
## Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Functional Consultant
This course provides students with the skills and knowledge required to successfully take a role as a Dynamics 365 Sales Functional Consultant. The course includes coverage of configuring Dynamics 365 Sales, managing cores sales tables, and configuring additional tools and services. Completion of the course prepares students for the [MB-210: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Functional Consultant](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/exams/mb-210) certification exam.
Students may be eligible for ACE college credit if they pass this certification exam. See [ACE college credit for certification exams](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/college-credit) for details.
## Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing
This course reviews the marketing application configuration needed to drive business growth. It dives into lead management, marketing forms and pages, segmentation, and email marketing messages. All these pieces are tied together through interactive customer journey design, including event and survey configuration. Completion of the course prepares students for the [MB-220: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/exams/mb-220) certification exam.
Students may be eligible for ACE college credit if they pass this certification exam. See [ACE college credit for certification exams](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/certifications/college-credit) for details.
Download the course datasheet [here.](https://aka.ms/mb220coursedatasheet)
## Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions
This course focuses on how to demonstrate subject matter expertise in designing cloud and hybrid solutions that run on Azure. Students will learn how to design identity, governance, and monitoring solutions; design data storage solutions; design business continuity solutions; and design infrastructure solutions. Completion of this course prepares students for the [AZ-305: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions](https://aka.ms/AZ305exam) exam.
ACE has reviewed and established credit recommendations for several Microsoft Certification exams. You can see the full list at https://aka.ms/ACECollegeCredit

Your responsibilities for this role include advising stakeholders and translating business requirements into designs for Azure solutions that align with the Azure Well-Architected Framework and Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure. In this role, you implement solutions on Azure by partnering with various other job roles, including:

- Developers
- Administrators
- Security engineers
- Data engineers

As a candidate for this exam, you should have advanced experience and knowledge of IT operations, including networking, virtualization, identity, security, business continuity, disaster recovery, data platforms, and governance. You should manage how decisions in each area affect an overall solution. In addition, you should have experience with:

- Azure administration
- Azure development
- DevOps processes

Important

The English language version of this exam was updated on October 18, 2024. Review the study guide linked in the “Tip” box for details about latest changes. If a localized version of this exam is available, it will be updated approximately eight weeks after this date. While Microsoft makes every effort to update localized versions as noted, there may be times when the localized versions of this exam are not updated on this schedule.

Passing score: 700. [Learn more about exam scores.](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exam-scoring-reports#scores-needed-to-pass-exams)

Tip

- Watch [AZ-305 exam prep videos](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/shows/exam-readiness-zone/preparing-for-az-305-design-identity-governance-and-monitoring-solutions-1-of-4) on Learn
- Review the [AZ-305 study guide](https://aka.ms/AZ305-StudyGuide) to help you prepare for the exam

**Retirement date:** none 

 This exam measures your ability to accomplish the following technical tasks: design identity, governance, and monitoring solutions; design data storage solutions; design business continuity solutions; and design infrastructure solutions. 

Price based on the country or region in which the exam is proctored.

We strongly recommend that you register for an exam with a personal MSA account. If you register with an organizational (work/school) AAD account, your exam records will be lost if you leave your organization and they will be unrecoverable.

Take a free practice assessment

results.title: AZ-305 Microsoft Azure Architect Design Prerequisites - Training
results.content:
# AZ-305 Microsoft Azure Architect Design Prerequisites

- Learning Path
- 6 Modules

##  At a glance

- Level 

[Intermediate](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?levels=intermediate&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure Storage](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure-storage&resource_type=learning%20path)[Azure Virtual Network](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure-virtual-network&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Solution Architect](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?roles=solution-architect&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Architecture](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=architecture&resource_type=learning%20path)

Learn the basic Azure concepts you'll need to know as an Azure infrastructure architect. This path gives you the knowledge to be successful as you begin studying for AZ-305: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions.

## Prerequisites

You should be familiar with basic computing concepts and terminology. Experience designing architecture solutions are desired, but not required.

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[Describe the core architectural components of Azure](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-core-architectural-components-of-azure/)

This module explains the basic infrastructure components of Microsoft Azure. You'll learn about the physical infrastructure, how resources are managed, and have a chance to create an Azure resource.

[Describe Azure compute and networking services](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-azure-compute-networking-services/)

This module focuses on some of the computer services and networking services available within Azure.

[Describe Azure storage services](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-azure-storage-services/)

This module introduces you to storage in Azure, including things such as different types of storage and how a distributed infrastructure can make your data more resilient.

[Describe Azure identity, access, and security](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/describe-azure-identity-access-security/)

This module covers some of the authorization and authentication methods available with Azure.

[Introduction to the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/cloud-adoption-framework/)

This module covers the basics of how to use the Cloud Adoption Framework, which is a set of documentation, implementation guidance, best practices, and tools that help you align your strategy for business, people, and technology.

[Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework](https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/azure-well-architected-introduction/)

You want to build great things on Azure, but you're not sure exactly what that means. Using key principles throughout your architecture, regardless of technology choice, can help you design, build, and continuously improve your architecture.

Candidates for this certification plan, implement, manage, and monitor security and compliance solutions for Microsoft 365 and hybrid environments. The Microsoft 365 security administrator proactively secures identity and access, implements threat protection, manages information protection, and enforces compliance. The Microsoft 365 security administrator collaborates with the Microsoft 365 enterprise administrator, business stakeholders, and other workload administrators to plan and implement security strategies.

Candidates for this certification have functional experience with Microsoft 365 workloads and with Microsoft Entra ID. ","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/m365-security-administrator/","iconUrl":"https://learn.microsoft.com/media/learn/certification/badges/microsoft-certified-associate-badge.svg","type":"certification","certificationType":"role-based","exams":null,"levels":["intermediate"],"roles":["administrator"],"products":["m365","entra-id","office-365"],"subjects":null,"studyGuide":null,"renewalFrequencyInDays":0,"prerequisites":[],"updatedAt":"2025-02-05T01:17:00+00:00"},{"id":"certification.security-operations-analyst","locale":"en-us","title":"Microsoft Certified: Security Operations Analyst Associate","subtitle":"

As a candidate for this certification, you’re a Microsoft security operations analyst who reduces organizational risk by:

  • Rapidly remediating active attacks in cloud and on-premises environments.
  • Advising on improvements to threat protection practices.
  • Identifying violations of organizational policies.

As a security operations analyst, you:

  • Perform triage.
  • Respond to incidents.
  • Mitigate risk by using exposure management.
  • Hunt for threats by using threat intelligence.
  • Use KQL for reporting, detections, and investigations

You also monitor, identify, investigate, and respond to threats in cloud and on-premises environments by using:

  • Microsoft Defender XDR
  • Security Copilot
  • Microsoft Sentinel
  • Microsoft Defender for Cloud workload protections
  • Third-party security solutions

You collaborate with business and security leadership to define security standards for the organization. You work with other roles across the digital enterprise to implement the standards, to enhance the security posture of an organization, and to raise security awareness.

As a candidate, you should be familiar with:

  • Microsoft 365
  • Azure cloud services
  • Windows, Linux, and mobile operating systems

As a candidate for this certification, you’re responsible for participating in all phases of development, including requirements gathering, design, development, deployment, security, maintenance, performance tuning, and monitoring.

You should be proficient in Azure:

  • SDK
  • Data storage options
  • Data connections
  • APIs
  • App authentication and authorization
  • Compute and container deployment
  • Debugging

To implement solutions, you partner with:

  • Cloud solution architects
  • DBAs
  • DevOps
  • Infrastructure admins
  • Other stakeholders

You should have:

  • At least two years of programming experience.
  • Proficiency in programming with Azure SDKs.
  • Proficiency using Azure CLI, Azure PowerShell, and other tools.

If you’re an administrator who deploys and manages Microsoft 365 and performs Microsoft 365 tenant-level implementation and administration of cloud and hybrid environments, this certification is designed for you.

As a Microsoft 365 administrator, you:

  • Function as the integrating hub for all Microsoft 365 workloads.
  • Coordinate across multiple Microsoft 365 workloads.
  • Work with architects and other administrators responsible for workloads, infrastructure, identity, security, compliance, endpoints, and applications.

As a candidate for this certification, you have functional experience with all Microsoft 365 workloads and Microsoft Entra ID and have administered at least one of these. You should also have a working knowledge of the following:

  • Networking
  • Active Directory Directory Services
  • DNS
  • PowerShell

To become a Microsoft 365 Certified: Administrator Expert, you must earn at least one of the following: Microsoft 365 Certified: Endpoint Administrator Associate, Microsoft 365 Certified: Messaging Administrator Associate, Microsoft 365 Certified: Teams Administrator Associate, Microsoft Certified: Identity and Access Administrator Associate, Microsoft Certified: Information Security Administrator Associate certification.

Important

The English language version of this certification was updated on November 10, 2025. Review the study guide linked on the Exam MS-102 page for details about recent changes.

This certification is an opportunity for you to demonstrate knowledge of machine learning and AI concepts and related Microsoft Azure services. As a candidate for this certification, you should have familiarity with the self-paced or instructor-led learning material.

This certification is intended for you if you have both technical and non-technical backgrounds. Data science and software engineering experience are not required. However, you would benefit from having awareness of:

  • Basic cloud concepts
  • Client-server applications

You can use Azure AI Fundamentals to prepare for other Azure role-based certifications like Azure Data Scientist Associate or Azure AI Engineer Associate, but it’s not a prerequisite for any of them.

You may be eligible for ACE college credit if you pass this certification. See ACE college credit for certification exams for details.

As a candidate for this certification, you should be a server or desktop administrator with subject matter expertise in designing, implementing, managing, and maintaining Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop experiences and remote apps for any device.

To deliver these experiences, you should work closely with:

  • Azure administrators
  • Azure architects
  • Microsoft 365 administrators
  • Azure security engineers
  • Azure Local administrators

You should have experience with Azure technologies, including:

  • Compute
  • Networking
  • Identity
  • Storage
  • Resiliency

You should be able to manage end-user desktop environments, including delivering applications and configuring user settings. You should use the Azure portal, templates, scripting, and command-line tools to manage an Azure Virtual Desktop deployment.

If you're a functional consultant, developer, information worker, or IT or business professional using Dynamics 365 Commerce to support your team and organization, this certification could help give your career a boost. As a candidate for this certification, you configure, deploy, and maintain Dynamics 365 Commerce applications.

Candidates must have a strong understanding of unified commerce business operations. They configure Dynamics 365 Commerce headquarters; configure and manage Commerce call centers, manage Store Commerce, manage e-commerce, and configure products, prices, discounts, loyalty, and affiliations.

If you need more experience before you try to earn this certification, here are some suggestions:

  • Work with a functional consultant on some Dynamics 365 Commerce projects.
  • Take available learning paths on Microsoft Learn.
  • Sign up for the MB-300 instructor-led training course.
  • Join the community of experts and peers at community.dynamics.com
  • Read the Discover your career path blog to learn more.

If you’re a functional consultant, a professional working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, or a developer looking to hone your consulting skills, this certification could help give your career a boost. It lets you market yourself more effectively for projects and shows your organization that you can use Dynamics 365 Sales to empower the sales force.

As a candidate for this certification, you have experience configuring Microsoft Power Platform and you know Dynamics 365 model-driven applications and data-modeling principles. You work with an organization’s stakeholders to gather requirements and implement Dynamics 365 Sales solutions. You manage leads, opportunities, quotes, and orders, and you configure product catalogs and price lists. Additionally, you configure Dynamics 365 Sales to match your organization's unique business process, and you model Dynamics 365 Sales data. You even extend Dynamics 365 solutions using Power Platform components, such as Power Automate and Power Apps.

If you need more experience before you try to earn this certification, here are some suggestions:

  • Work on a Dynamics 365 model-driven app implementation project.
  • Shadow a functional consultant or a solution architect who works with Dynamics 365 Sales.
  • Take available learning paths on Microsoft Learn.
  • Sign up for an instructor-led training course.

![](/en-us/training/achievements/microsoft-azure-architect-design-prerequisites.svg)

# AZ-305 Microsoft Azure Architect Design Prerequisites

- Learning Path
- 6 Modules

## At a glance

- Level 

[Intermediate](/en-us/training/browse/?levels=intermediate&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure Storage](/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure-storage&resource_type=learning%20path)[Azure Virtual Network](/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure-virtual-network&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Solution Architect](/en-us/training/browse/?roles=solution-architect&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Architecture](/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=architecture&resource_type=learning%20path)

Learn the basic Azure concepts you'll need to know as an Azure infrastructure architect. This path gives you the knowledge to be successful as you begin studying for AZ-305: Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions.

## Prerequisites

You should be familiar with basic computing concepts and terminology. Experience designing architecture solutions are desired, but not required.

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-core-architectural-components-of-azure.svg)](../../modules/describe-core-architectural-components-of-azure/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-core-architectural-components-of-azure.svg)

[Describe the core architectural components of Azure](../../modules/describe-core-architectural-components-of-azure/)

This module explains the basic infrastructure components of Microsoft Azure. You'll learn about the physical infrastructure, how resources are managed, and have a chance to create an Azure resource.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-azure-compute-networking-services.svg)](../../modules/describe-azure-compute-networking-services/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-azure-compute-networking-services.svg)

[Describe Azure compute and networking services](../../modules/describe-azure-compute-networking-services/)

This module focuses on some of the computer services and networking services available within Azure.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-azure-storage-services.svg)](../../modules/describe-azure-storage-services/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-azure-storage-services.svg)

[Describe Azure storage services](../../modules/describe-azure-storage-services/)

This module introduces you to storage in Azure, including things such as different types of storage and how a distributed infrastructure can make your data more resilient.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-azure-identity-access-security.svg)](../../modules/describe-azure-identity-access-security/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/describe-azure-identity-access-security.svg)

[Describe Azure identity, access, and security](../../modules/describe-azure-identity-access-security/)

This module covers some of the authorization and authentication methods available with Azure.

[![](/en-us/learn/achievements/microsoft-cloud-adoption-framework-for-azure.svg)](../../modules/cloud-adoption-framework/)

![](/en-us/learn/achievements/microsoft-cloud-adoption-framework-for-azure.svg)

[Introduction to the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework](../../modules/cloud-adoption-framework/)

This module covers the basics of how to use the Cloud Adoption Framework, which is a set of documentation, implementation guidance, best practices, and tools that help you align your strategy for business, people, and technology.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/azure-well-architected-introduction.svg)](../../modules/azure-well-architected-introduction/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/azure-well-architected-introduction.svg)

[Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework](../../modules/azure-well-architected-introduction/)

You want to build great things on Azure, but you're not sure exactly what that means. Using key principles throughout your architecture, regardless of technology choice, can help you design, build, and continuously improve your architecture.

Start

![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-identity-governance-solution.svg)

# AZ-305: Design identity, governance, and monitor solutions

- Learning Path
- 3 Modules

## At a glance

- Level 

[Advanced](/en-us/training/browse/?levels=advanced&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure](/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Solution Architect](/en-us/training/browse/?roles=solution-architect&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Identity and access](/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=identity-access&resource_type=learning%20path)[Compliance](/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=compliance&resource_type=learning%20path)[Security](/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=security&resource_type=learning%20path)

Design identity, governance, and monitor solutions including authentication.

## Prerequisites

- Conceptual knowledge of identity, governance, and monitoring solutions.
- Working experience with integrating identity and governance solutions.

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?cid=msft_learn)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-governance.svg)](../../modules/design-governance/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-governance.svg)

[Design governance](../../modules/design-governance/)

Azure Architects design and recommend governance solutions.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-authentication-authorization.svg)](../../modules/design-authentication-authorization-solutions/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-authentication-authorization.svg)

[Design authentication and authorization solutions](../../modules/design-authentication-authorization-solutions/)

Azure Architects design and recommend authentication and authorization solutions.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/azure-resources-design-solution.svg)](../../modules/design-solution-to-log-monitor-azure-resources/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/azure-resources-design-solution.svg)

[Design a solution to log and monitor Azure resources](../../modules/design-solution-to-log-monitor-azure-resources/)

Azure Architects design and recommend logging and monitoring solutions.

Start

![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-storage-solution.svg)

# AZ-305: Design data storage solutions

- Learning Path
- 3 Modules

## At a glance

- Level 

[Advanced](/en-us/training/browse/?levels=advanced&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure](/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Solution Architect](/en-us/training/browse/?roles=solution-architect&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Data management](/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=data-management&resource_type=learning%20path)

Design data storage solutions including non-relational storage, relational storage, and data integration.

## Prerequisites

- Conceptual knowledge of storage accounts, blobs, files, disks, data protection, and databases.
- Working experience with creating and securing storage systems, designing database solutions, and integrating data solutions.

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?cid=msft_learn)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/data-storage-solution-non-relation-data.svg)](../../modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-non-relational-data/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/data-storage-solution-non-relation-data.svg)

[Design a data storage solution for non-relational data](../../modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-non-relational-data/)

Azure Architect's design and recommend nonrelational data storage solutions.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-data-storage-relational-data.svg)](../../modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-relational-data/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-data-storage-relational-data.svg)

[Design a data storage solution for relational data](../../modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-relational-data/)

Azure Architect's design and recommend relational data storage solutions.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-data-integration.svg)](../../modules/design-data-integration/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-data-integration.svg)

[Design data integration](../../modules/design-data-integration/)

Azure Architects design and recommend data integration solutions.

Start

![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-business-continuity-solutions.svg)

# AZ-305: Design business continuity solutions

- Learning Path
- 2 Modules

## At a glance

- Level 

[Advanced](/en-us/training/browse/?levels=advanced&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Skill 

 
- Product 

[Azure](/en-us/training/browse/?products=azure&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Role 

[Solution Architect](/en-us/training/browse/?roles=solution-architect&resource_type=learning%20path)
- Subject 

[Site reliability engineering](/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=site-reliability-engineering&resource_type=learning%20path)[DevOps](/en-us/training/browse/?subjects=devops&resource_type=learning%20path)

Design business continuity solutions including high availability, backup, and disaster recovery.

## Prerequisites

- Working experience with designing highly available architectures.
- Conceptual knowledge of high availability for applications, databases, and compute resources.
- Conceptual knowledge of Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery solutions.
- Working experience with object replication, backup solution tools, and recovery options.

## Get started with Azure

Choose the Azure account that's right for you. Pay as you go or try Azure free for up to 30 days. [Sign up.](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/purchase-options/azure-account?cid=msft_learn)

**Achievement Code**

Would you like to request an achievement code?

## Modules in this learning path

[![](/en-us/learn/achievements/describe-high-availability-and-disaster-recovery-strategies.svg)](../../modules/describe-high-availability-disaster-recovery-strategies/)

![](/en-us/learn/achievements/describe-high-availability-and-disaster-recovery-strategies.svg)

[Describe high availability and disaster recovery strategies](../../modules/describe-high-availability-disaster-recovery-strategies/)

Plan an appropriate high availability and disaster recovery strategy based on recovery time objective and recovery point objective. Choose the best solution for IaaS or PaaS deployments or hybrid workloads.

[![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-solution-backup-recovery-disaster-recovery.svg)](../../modules/design-solution-for-backup-disaster-recovery/)

![](/en-us/training/achievements/design-solution-backup-recovery-disaster-recovery.svg)

[Design a solution for backup and disaster recovery](../../modules/design-solution-for-backup-disaster-recovery/)

Learn how to select appropriate backup solutions and disaster recovery solutions for Azure workloads.

Start

Covers governance structure, authN/authZ design, and monitoring/logging design choices."},{"title":"AZ-305: Design data storage
